title: Ration Water Effectively During Sea Survival
brief: Conserve limited freshwater supplies and reduce water loss through proper rationing and body cooling techniques.
steps: Step 1: Do not eat if you have no water available.
Step 2: If water ration is 2+ liters per day, eat normally including any caught food.
Step 3: Moisten lips, tongue, and throat before swallowing water.
Step 4: Keep body well-shaded from overhead sun and water reflection.
Step 5: Soak clothes in seawater and wring out before putting on to reduce perspiration.
Step 6: Do not exert yourself - relax and sleep when possible.
Step 7: Set daily water ration based on available water, solar still output, and group size/condition.
warnings: Do not drink seawater, urine, or alcohol.
Do not smoke as it increases dehydration.
Don't overdo seawater cooling on hot days without canopy - can cause saltwater boils and rashes.
If nauseated, take only water and rest - eating when nauseated causes immediate food loss.
